content:
Diagnosis:	Pancreatic adenocarcinoma, Stage IIA (T3N0M0)

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Whipple's procedure
		28 Feb - 12 Apr 2024 Adjuvant FOLFIRINOX chemotherapy

Histology:	Moderately differentiated pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, ERBB2 mutation positive

Current Situation:	Post-treatment surveillance

I reviewed [redacted name] in clinic today following completion of adjuvant chemotherapy. She has recovered well from her treatment with resolution of previous grade 1 peripheral neuropathy. Her weight has stabilized at 68kg and appetite has improved. She reports good energy levels and has returned to work part-time.

Current blood tests show stable CA19-9 at 15 (within normal range). Recent CT scan on 15/5/24 shows post-surgical changes with no evidence of disease recurrence. Liver function tests remain normal.

The plan is to continue regular surveillance. I have arranged follow up CT scan in 3 months and clinic review thereafter. She understands to contact us sooner if any new concerns develop.

cancer_timeline.value: CT scan shows post-surgical changes with no evidence of disease recurrence

status_updates.value: Stage IIA pancreatic cancer post Whipple's and adjuvant chemotherapy. No evidence of recurrence on latest imaging with normal tumor markers
resolution of previous grade 1 peripheral neuropathy
weight stabilized at 68kg with improved appetite and energy levels
follow up CT scan in 3 months
